segment.source: File Type Associations Node
segment.target: File Type Associations Node

segment.source: File Type Associations Node
segment.target: File Type Associations Node

segment.source: File Type Associations Node
segment.target: File Type Associations Node

segment.source: The File Type Associations node is one level below the Application Virtualization node in the Scope pane of the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: The File Type Associations node is one level below the Application Virtualization node in the Scope pane of the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of file type associations.
segment.target: When you select this node, the Results pane displays a list of file type associations.

segment.source: Right-click the File Type Associations node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.
segment.target: Right-click the File Type Associations node to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.

segment.source: New Association
segment.target: New Association

segment.source: This menu item displays the New Association Wizard.
segment.target: This menu item displays the New Association Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of two pages:
segment.target: This wizard consists of two pages:

segment.source: Enter a new or existing file name extension, and associate the extension with a file type:
segment.target: Enter a new or existing file name extension, and associate the extension with a file type:

segment.source: Extension—Enter a new or existing file name extension.
segment.target: Extension—Enter a new or existing file name extension.

segment.source: This field is blank by default.
segment.target: This field is blank by default.

segment.source: Create a new file type with this description—Select this radio button to enter a new file type description in the active field.
segment.target: Create a new file type with this description—Select this radio button to enter a new file type description in the active field.

segment.source: This button is selected by default, and the active field is blank.
segment.target: This button is selected by default, and the active field is blank.

segment.source: Apply this file type to all users—Select this check box when you want this association to be global for all users.
segment.target: Apply this file type to all users—Select this check box when you want this association to be global for all users.

segment.source: By default, this box is not selected.
segment.target: By default, this box is not selected.

segment.source: Link this extension with an existing file type—Select this radio button to associate the extension with an existing file type.
segment.target: Link this extension with an existing file type—Select this radio button to associate the extension with an existing file type.

segment.source: Choose a file type from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Choose a file type from the drop-down list.

segment.source: When you choose this option, Next is changed to Finish.
segment.target: When you choose this option, Next is changed to Finish.

segment.source: Select the application that will open files with the specified extension:
segment.target: Select the application that will open files with the specified extension:

segment.source: Open files with the selected application—Select this radio button to open the file with an existing application.
segment.target: Open files with the selected application—Select this radio button to open the file with an existing application.

segment.source: Choose an application from the drop-down list of available applications.
segment.target: Choose an application from the drop-down list of available applications.

segment.source: Open files with the application described in this OSD file—Select this radio button to specify an Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file that determines the application used to open the file.
segment.target: Open files with the application described in this OSD file—Select this radio button to specify an Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file that determines the application used to open the file.

segment.source: Browse to select an existing location, or enter a path or HTTP-formatted URL in this field.
segment.target: Browse to select an existing location, or enter a path or HTTP-formatted URL in this field.

segment.source: New Window from Here
segment.target: New Window from Here

segment.source: Select this menu item to open a new management console with the selected node as the root node.
segment.target: Select this menu item to open a new management console with the selected node as the root node.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: You can use this menu item to create a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: You can use this menu item to create a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: This pop-up list of menu items enables you to change the appearance and content of the Results pane.
segment.target: This pop-up list of menu items enables you to change the appearance and content of the Results pane.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Select this item to refresh the management console.
segment.target: Select this item to refresh the management console.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: With this menu item, you can display the help system for the management console.
segment.target: With this menu item, you can display the help system for the management console.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: File Type Association Results Pane
segment.target: File Type Association Results Pane

segment.source: File Type Association Results Pane Columns
segment.target: File Type Association Results Pane Columns
